resources.string: Aw, snap! Something went wrong, please try again.
Something went wrong while reading / writing internal files. Do you have enough free space?
Aw, snap! There was an error while encrypting your text.
The data could not be decrypted. Is this a ciphertext from Crypdroid or Cryptool2? May the data be corrupted?
The data could not be decrypted. Is this the correct password?
The text was copied to the clipboard.
Save the file with the following filename:
Attention: Do not choose to show the ciphertext, if it is big (e.g. an encrypted image). This could cause Crypdroid to run out of memory.
What do you want to do with it?
Received a file from another App
What do you want to do with it?
What do you want to do with it?
Please choose 1 of the options to get started:

Crypdroid en- and decrypts your files and texts with the AES-256 algorithm.

Your data is encrypted with a session-key that is derived from a passwort entered by you. For this the cryptograpic standard PKCS #5 is used. The combination of the AES-256 with a session-key protects your data for years to come!

Crypdroid is combatibel with the tool "Encrypt with Password" in the Open-Source-Software CrypTool 2. Therefore you are able to not only exchange encrypted texts between every Android device with Crypdroid but also with every PC that has Cryptool 2 installed.

Do you have an idea on how to improve Crypdroid or do you want to lend a hand in the further development of Crypdroid? Or do you want to be sure that Crypdroid does protect your personal data?
You are in luck because Crypdroid is Open Source! The source code is published on github.com.
Do not grant any Application this permission
